alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Martin (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 09 at 7:00AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Indiana, including the following counties, Daviess and Martin. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 700 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated slow moving thunderstorms with very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 3 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Shoals, Loogootee, Plainville, Montgomery, Cannelburg, West Boggs Lake and Lacy. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
